task_summary: Pick up the green apple visible on the table using the robot arm, following a structured perceive-approach-grasp sequence.

task_long_description.overview: The episode depicts a robotic arm tasked with picking up a green apple from a small table. The workspace contains three fruits (a green apple, an orange, a red apple) and several white objects for reference, with actions focused on perception, approach, computation of grasp, and execution. The process involves visual detection and confirmation, gripper preparation, controlled approach, precise alignment, and a top-down grasp. No placement is executed within the viewed sequence.
preconditions: Green apple present on the table
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the green apple or scan until found
Detect green apple and confirm its location
Open the gripper to a suitable width
Move to a safe position above the green apple
Compute an optimal top grasp pose
Approach and align precisely with the apple
success_criteria: Green apple securely held in gripper
No collision with other fruits or table
failure_and_recovery: Green apple not detected: re-scan up to 3 times
Failed alignment or grasp: recovery out of scope for this sequence
task_long_description.termination: Upon successful stable grasp of the green apple or unrecoverable detection/grasp failure

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the green apple is currently visible to the robot's sensors
Scans the workspace for the green apple using a raster pattern
Detects precise pose of the green apple
Opens the gripper to prepare for grasping
Moves the gripper to a position above the green apple
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the green apple
Approaches and aligns the gripper with the green apple for grasp
Executes grasping at the computed top pose
Verifies the grasp is stable after picking up the green apple

failure_modes: Green apple not visible after 3 scan attempts
recovery_strategy: Retry scan if object not visible (up to 3 times)
Abort if object cannot be detected or grasp fails
assumptions: The instruction maps to the green apple visible in all frames; no placement or transfer is depicted in this episode.
Symbolic target 'green_apple' is derived from appearance; result_key 'std_top' is used for grasp pose.
No force or precise tolerance targets are mentioned in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Green apple is securely grasped by the robot gripper
